TextBody:
Hello Pramod,

Thank you for your time in today's session. 

I have verified internally,  as we discussed, if there is anything that we can do regarding the threats that are not meeting the threshold. 
As I mentioned in the meeting, you can create a new policy with Report Only action to monitor the file transfers or you can modify the threshold to 1, so that will be blocked and in order to be transferred an approval will be required.

Have a nice day ahead! 

Best regards,
__________________
Daniel Anton | Technical Support Engineer
Endpoint Protector by CoSoSys, now part of Netwrix
DLP | MDM | Device Control | Content Aware Protection
www.endpointprotector.com

daniel.anton@endpointprotector.com



This Email may contain confidential information. Not to be disclosed to third parties without prior written approval.

ref:_00D7091pB._500Q000BTF29:ref

Hi Daniel,

We would prefer to set the teshould at 5 to better accommodate our needs,
given that our employees frequently share one or two SSA data daily, this
treshould is not practical for our operations.
Let me know if there are any workarounds for this.

Hi Daniel,

We would prefer to set the teshould at 5 to better accommodate our needs, given that our employees frequently share one or two SSA data daily, this treshould is not practical for our operations.
Let me know if there are any workarounds for this.

On Thu, Jun 6, 2024 at 5:22 PM Netwrix Support <techsupport@netwrix.com<mailto:techsupport@netwrix.com>> wrote:
Hello Pramod,

Thank you for your time in today's session.

I have verified internally,  as we discussed, if there is anything that we can do regarding the threats that are not meeting the threshold.
As I mentioned in the meeting, you can create a new policy with Report Only action to monitor the file transfers or you can modify the threshold to 1, so that will be blocked and in order to be transferred an approval will be required.

Have a nice day ahead!

Best regards,

Subject: Re: SPF violationRe: Netwrix Support Ticket #411042 - - Senstive data are not getting detected and stopped on whatsapp while copy pasting it [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0BTF29:ref ]

TextBody:
ref:_00D7091pB._500Q000BTF29:ref

Hi Pramod,

Please note that it is not possible to get logs for transfers of files that
do not meet the threat threshold value defined in the CAP policy - since
the Threat Threshold field was designed to work as a "starting point" or
"minimum" for the number of sensitive data items inside a file.
If you need to get logs when the file contains at least one sensitive data
item, the Threat Threshold value should be set to '1'.

Please let me know if this clarifies everything.

Thanks,
Natalie

Natalie Avdeenco | Solutions Engineer

Endpoint Protector by CoSoSys, now part of Netwrix

DLP | Device Control | Content Aware Protection | eDiscovery | Enforced
Encryption

www.endpointprotector.com

(+40) 264-593 110




This Email may contain confidential information. Not to be disclosed to
third parties without prior written approval.

>> Hello Pramod,
>>
>> Thank you for your time in today's session.
>>
>> I have verified internally,  as we discussed, if there is anything that
>> we can do regarding the threats that are not meeting the threshold.
>> As I mentioned in the meeting, you can create a new policy with Report
>> Only action to monitor the file transfers or you can modify the threshold
>> to 1, so that will be blocked and in order to be transferred an approval
>> will be required.
